captions.text: Very exciting project that we're going to be starting next week and I want both of you guys to be on it.
Is that.. Ok with you Erin?
*House music plays* Yea.. Of course
*Man Speaking in the background* If I am not super diligent, the minute my face starts resting... I'm a bitch.
*House Music*
Hey Come on.. Cheer up! It's Bagel Day!
Ok just because I'm not smiling doesn't mean I'm miserable.
He sounds great...
He is Great...
That's what I meant! Do you think he's not great?
Sometimes my face has a really hard time expressing excitement... It sucks..
Oh, hey did you hear about Calvin's party, it's gonna be so fun!... There's like... You don't seem that excited about this... Never mind, it's alright.
Fuck! I'm excited... I'm excited...
Erin, we're a little worried about your attitude... We think you should smile more.
Stop saying that. I'm pretty sure it's an HR violation.
You Know... Whatsup? When I first met you I thought you hated me.. So funny..
You know... That one's kind of offensive.
Wait what's wrong?
What?
You look like something's really wrong.
I'm just thinking... Look, this is just how my face is, ok?
If this is about last night, I'm so sorry.
*House music happily continues*

title: 7 Things Ladies With Resting Bitch Face Want You To Know

comments.author: 12calliegirl

comments.author: Mia Spieler

comments.author: Tara Caitlin

comments.text:
I get these comments all the time.

"Cheer up, it can't be that bad." 
"Smile!"
"Hasn't she got a nice smile, you should smile more" 
"You look better when you smile" 
"You look happy"
"Did I scare you, I don't want you to be scared of me" oh c'mon srs.  

And my generic response is usually 

*forced laughter* 

My resting face is a mix between pissed and upset I suppose.  I can't help 
that! I'm not going to carry a mirror with me or make myself feel 
uncomfortable trying to smile all the time to please others.  Just because 
I don't smile all the time doesn't mean I'm a bad person,  I only smile 
when I mean it.  

On the plus side no one ever knows what I'm thinking, it's great for 
checking out people.﻿
comments.author: Nivanfield

comments.text:

comments.author: Gwyneth Dianne Asturias

comments.text:
This apply to me on so many levels that it's sad.

When I'm not smiling-now I'm forced to smile all the time-people ask me if 
I'm okay? Am I like sad? Others thinks I'm neurotic! No! I'm almost always 
happy, I just don't like smiling every second of the day. Some days I'm 
more smiley, and other days I act mean(I don't think so) but trust me, I'm 
happy because the moment I see my friends I'm all smiley and excited if I'm 
not tired! 
Stop saying I'm mean and rude! Call me mean but never rude, I feel bad for 
my amazing strict parents when it comes to manners!
Ugh! People!﻿

comments.text:
The problem is that it's Bitchy Resting Face. Resting Bitch Face implies 
that it's a bitch's face at rest rather than being a resting face that 
looks bitchy. It's an important distinction.﻿
